name: CreatePreReceiveHook
description:
Create a pre-receive hook for GitHub enterprise administration.

Use this tool when you need to create a pre-receive hook for managing GitHub enterprise repositories. It's crucial for setting up checks before code is accepted.

parameters.name: pre_receive_hook_configuration
parameters.description: A JSON object containing details for creating a pre-receive hook, including name, script, enforcement state, and other settings.

allow_downstream_configuration.description: Whether enforcement can be overridden at the org or repo level. default: `false`

enforcement.description: The state of enforcement for this hook. default: `disabled`

environment.description: The pre-receive environment where the script is executed.

script.description: The script that the hook runs.

script_repository.description: The GitHub repository where the script is kept.
